org.javasimon.jmx

Class CounterMXBeanImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.javasimon.jmx.AbstractSimonMXBeanImpl
      • org.javasimon.jmx.CounterMXBeanImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, CounterMXBean, SimonSuperMXBean

    public class CounterMXBeanImpl
extends AbstractSimonMXBeanImpl
implements CounterMXBean
    MX Bean representing a particular Counter. It is not created by default when JMX is activated - it must be created explicitly. JmxRegisterCallback can be used to automate this.

    Class can be subclassed to override default behavior if desired, counter is declared protected for this reason.

    Author:
    Richard "Virgo" Richter
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Samples Simon values and returns them in a Java Bean derived from Sample interface.

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • sampleIncrement

        public CounterSample sampleIncrement(String key)
        Description copied from interface: SimonSuperMXBean
        Samples increment in Simon values since the previous call of this method with the same key. When the method is called the first time for the key, current values are returned (same like from SimonSuperMXBean.sample(). Any subsequent calls with the key provide increments.

        Clients should use a unique key (GUID, host name, etc.), to avoid interference with other clients.

        Specified by:
        sampleIncrement in interface CounterMXBean
        Specified by:
        sampleIncrement in interface SimonSuperMXBean
        Parameters:
        key - key used to access incremental sample
        Returns:
        Sample with value increments

      • getType

        public final String getType()
        Description copied from interface: SimonSuperMXBean
        Returns Simon type used as a property in the ObjectName.
        Specified by:
        getType in interface SimonSuperMXBean
        Returns:
        Simon type

      • stopIncrementalSampling

        public boolean stopIncrementalSampling(String key)
        Description copied from interface: SimonSuperMXBean
        Stops incremental sampling for the key, removing any internal information for the key. Next call to SimonSuperMXBean.sampleIncrement(String) for the key will be considered the first call for the key.
        Specified by:
        stopIncrementalSampling in interface SimonSuperMXBean
        Parameters:
        key - key used to access incremental sample
        Returns:
        true if incremental information for the key existed, false otherwise
